name: TFD Domain Recolor
description: A basic hack'n'slash CSS to recolor the ultra bright background of TheFreeDictionary.com.
additional_info:
I don't code, but the recent upgrade to TFD made it essentially unusable, so I jury-rigged some basic color overrides.  Feel free to tweak colors (background: #xxxxxx) as needed.  And if anyone with a CSS background wants to improve upon this, go for it!  Once I started using the sort of neutral grey-violets for everything, I stopped getting so many headaches at work. 

For Chrome, I used:
URLs:  http://www.thefreedictionary.com/ and http://www.thefreelibrary.com/
URLs on the Domain:  http://www.thefreedictionary.com/[*] and http://www.thefreelibrary.com/[*]
URLs matching the regexp:  http(s)?://.*\.www.thefreelibrary\.com/(?!plugins/|Fplugins).* and http(s)?://.*\.www.thefreedictionary\.com/(?!plugins/|Fplugins).*

Do I need all those?  No idea, but was just trying to get something to work in about 30min scattered through the workday on brief breaks.
